author: bleVegeta

text: Far From The Madding Crowd has got to be, one of my most loved love stories that I ever have had the pleasure of reading. Hardy is such a skillful writer and artist. The way he described his characters, their surroundings, and the way he weaved the plot together was so seamlessly intricate, heartbreaking, and uplifting. I honestly believe the relationship between Farmer Oak and Miss Bathsheba to be one of the most realistic portrayals of true love, and I distinctly remember as a young teen reading the book when I was only 15 or so, I thought to myself, "I want a man like Farmer Oak - who will love me despite my ugly flaws, appreciate and values my strengths, protects me, is critical of me, stern and honest."
author: Farhana Abdul Fatah

text: An excellent film. Sure Hardy would be pleased! A great cast, headed by the beautiful Carey Mulligan, bring the book to vivid life.
